Reviews.Title: “Basic but good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: OldCapernwray
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in the centre of Rome at a reasonable price and chose the Hotel Principe Amadeus. The hotel is convenient and clean but very basic, only the Reception area and the rooms. The rooms were fine, very clean, towels changed every day, smallish shower cubicle but fine for most people. If you just want somewhere to sleep, it will serve you well. The hotel staff were helpful, friendly and courteous and responded to all our requests. Some reviews criticise the street noise, but we didn't find it a problem during the night, the windows were double glazed with hinged blinds which cut out most of the sound, it did get a little louder from 07.30 onwards but wasn't excessive to say it's in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ygmd
Reviews.Content: Was looking for an hotel to stay for 1 night before leaving Rome. It is located close to the Termini which is good, but beside that... It is a very basic hotel with rooms located on street level! All night we had to hear the cars, bikes, shouting, and what not and couldn't sleep for a second! Bottom line - look else where

Reviews.Title: “Convenient accomodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Danielearro
Reviews.Content: I was told it is very difficult to find a convenient accomodation in Rome, well, this is not the case of Hotel Principe Amedeo. Don't expect any luxus, however you get everything you need for resting after visiting the town: comfortable bed, toilet with shower, towels changed. The rooms are indeed quite spacious and functional for a 2 stars. Breakfast is not included, they have room service but the staff was also kind in advising us to have breakfast in the good café in front of the hotel, and warned us that prices at the table are more expensive than prices at the bar counter. Rooms are at ground floor so they are quite noisy because of traffic jams. Well, it belongs to Rome, bring earplugs if you don't have strong sleep. Rooms have air conditioning, which is good also for heating in winter. Minor faults: the fan of the bathroom was quite noisy and the towels are quite thin. Location is very good, from there you get everywhere, on foot, metro or bus. The restaurants around the hotel are not the best ones in Rome, go to Trastevere or ask advice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value”
Reviews.Author: petr_kovar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well situated, 10 minutes by walk from the Termini station and also all the main sights are reachable on your own (Colloseum cca 35 minutes of walk) The staff is very plesant and willing, rooms offer all the neccesary for people who want to explore the city and not to spend their holiday inside the hotel. I think the "prize/performance" ratio is perfect, so I would recommend you this place.

Reviews.Title: “NICE AND CHEAP”
Reviews.Author: salonicco90
Reviews.Content: a very nice hotel in the center of the city almost 5 minutes walk from termini and two minutes walk from metro station republicca

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Kezino
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean and tidy. Owned by a family of very pleasant people. Situation is perfect - all sights are within 20 mins of walking.

Reviews.Title: “There is no "cheap, but good" in Rome! Don't be cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Anja_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: Rome was my last stop during my trip around Italy this summer, and I was kind of broke. So I thought I'd book a cheap central hotel... I read some reviews and this Principe Amedeo seemed nice.. But actually it was not. Do not expect much. It is 2 star hotel and nothing more than that. Not a good experience at all! It was noisy, sort of clean, but not exactly (especially the bathroom), no breakfast place etc etc... Unless you are a poor student, don't be cheap! Book a proper hotel! Your stay in Rome will be so much nicer!
